shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content_distilled: Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.

shorts.title: St. Francis of Assisi Kitchen donation from Post 7069
shorts.description: VFW Abington Memorial Post 7069 and Auxiliary, Clarks Summit, donated $1,750 to the St. Francis of Assisi Kitchen “Host For the Day” program. From left: Donald Jones, Post 7069 commander; Rob Williams, kitchen executive director; and Michael McLane, Post 7069 quartermaster/adjutant.
shorts.content: VFW Abington Memorial Post 7069 and Auxiliary, Clarks Summit, donated $1,750 to the St. Francis of Assisi Kitchen “Host For the Day” program. From left: Donald Jones, Post 7069 commander; Rob Williams, kitchen executive director; and Michael McLane, Post 7069 quartermaster/adjutant.

shorts.title: Actors Circle presents ‘Love, Sex and the I.R.S.’
shorts.title_distilled: Actors Circle presents ‘Love, Sex and the I.
shorts.description: Actors Circle presents the comedy “Love, Sex and the I.R.S.,” directed by Mark Fryer, Jan. 15, 16, 17, 18, 23, 24 and 25, Thursday-Saturday at 7 p.m., and Sunday at 2 p.m., at Providence Playhouse, 1256 Providence Road in Scranton. Buy tickets online via www.Actorscirclescranton.com, or pay cash or check at the door. Tickets: $15/general, $12/senior and $10/student. On Thursday, Jan. 15, all tickets are $10. Reservations: 570-342-9707. Co-authors Billy Van Zandt and the late Jane Milmore crafted a hilarious story about paying taxes, getting audited, mistaken identity, romance and a surprise visit from Mom. Centered on subjects that many […]
shorts.content: Actors Circle presents the comedy “Love, Sex and the I.R.S.,” directed by Mark Fryer, Jan. 15, 16, 17, 18, 23, 24 and 25, Thursday-Saturday at 7 p.m., and Sunday at 2 p.m., at Providence Playhouse, 1256 Providence Road in Scranton. Buy tickets online via www.Actorscirclescranton.com, or pay cash or check at the door. Tickets: $15/general, $12/senior and $10/student. On Thursday, Jan. 15, all tickets are $10. shorts.title: GIRLS BASKETBALL: Lackawanna League play resumes after holiday tournaments
shorts.title_distilled: GIRLS BASKETBALL: Lackawanna League play resumes after holiday tournaments.
shorts.description: Chrissy Jacklinski and her Scranton High School girls basketball teammates knew the start to their season would be a challenge, and it was. The Lady Knights lost six of their first seven games to opponents who are a combined 50-9 — Crestwood (12-0), Dallas (10-0), Hazleton Area (9-1), St. Thomas Aquinas from New Jersey (6-3), North Pocono (7-2) and York William Penn (6-3). Three of those defeats were by six points or fewer. However, they also realized that schedule would benefit them in the long run. “Even in the summer, we knew what our schedule was,” Jacklinski said. “We knew […]

shorts.title: Hikers start New Year outside for 'First Day Hikes'
shorts.title_distilled: Hikers start New Year outside for 'First Day Hikes'.
shorts.description: NORTH ABINGTON TWP., LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — Despite the chilly start to the New Year, some hiked into 2026. The first day of the year brought first day hikes, 60 across the commonwealth, including one at Lackawanna State Park in North Abington Township. The hikes were held in 49 state parks and three forest districts, [...]
